mvp.concurrent

Class AbstractConcurrentListenerController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvp.core.AbstractController
      • mvp.listener.AbstractListenerController
        • mvp.concurrent.AbstractConcurrentListenerController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class AbstractConcurrentListenerController
extends AbstractListenerController
    A concurrent enhancement of the AbstractListenerController. This class is designed to handle the process of off-loading the execution of events, updating of property models, and other processes from the EventDispatchThread to background threads. It also ensures that that all property changes are returned to the view on the EventDispatchThread, thus preserving the thread safety of the GUI.

    This process is controlled by three methods:

    actionPerformed(ActionEvent) is a method that is invoked while still on the EDT. It checks the event to see if the source is an instance of ListenerView, and if so it invokes the getValueForAction(String). This invocation is safe because it occurs while still on the EDT. This method then passes both the event and the value (if it was acquired) to a background thread for processing.

    processEvent(ActionEvent,Object) parses the event to determine the appropriate response. This method is abstract and needs to be implemented to extend this class. This method is virtually guaranteed to be accessed by more than one thread at once, so proper synchronization and thread safety is a must. Implementations of this method generally update property models and perform various other lengthy background tasks.

    propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent) is invoked while on the background thread when a bound property is changed in one of the models. It safely wraps the changeProperty(PropertyChangeEvent) methods from the views in SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable) to ensure that the event is only passed to the view on the EDT.

    Lastly, the executor used by this class to manage the thread pool is a protected field and available to subclasses. This is primarily done to allow for its threads to be used for other concurrent operations, avoiding the need to create additional thread pools. However, subclasses can determine if they wish to use the existing pool for this purpose, or if they would rather create additional pools instead.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is thread safe. The only possible compromise to its safety would come from the GUI classes sending ActionEvents to this class not being properly contained to the EDT, but that would be a problem outside of the control of this class.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    ListenerView

    • Field Detail

      • eventExecutor

        protected final java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService eventExecutor
        The executor that offloads various actions onto background threads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractConcurrentListenerController

        public AbstractConcurrentListenerController()
        Constructs an instance of this controller with no set thread pool size. Threads are created as needed, as many threads as are necessary, and when they're no longer in use they are disposed of.

      • AbstractConcurrentListenerController

        public AbstractConcurrentListenerController(int threadPoolSize)
        Constructs an instance of this controller with a fixed thread pool size. The exact number of threads specified here are created at initialization. Unless the properties of the thread pool are altered, there will never be more threads than this available during the lifespan of this object, and any threads that die will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        threadPoolSize - the fixed size of the thread pool.

      • AbstractConcurrentListenerController

        public AbstractConcurrentListenerController(int corePoolSize,
                                            int maximumPoolSize,
                                            long keepAliveTime,
                                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Constructs an instance of this controller with a much more detailed configuration. The parameters set the minimum number of threads to be available at all times (corePoolSize), the maximum number of threads that could be created (maximumPoolSize), and the time to keep any additional threads beyond the core pool size alive (keepAliveTime, unit).
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the minimum number of threads to be available at all times.
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads that could be created.
        keepAliveTime - the raw number for the amount of time to keep threads beyond the core pool size alive.
        unit - the unit of time for the keepAliveTime value.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown(boolean interruptIfRunning)
        Sends a shutdown command to the executor. If the boolean parameter is true, threads will be interrupted while running to accelerate the shutdown process.
        Parameters:
        interruptIfRunning - whether or not to interrupt running threads during shutdown.

      • setThreadFactory

        public void setThreadFactory(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory factory)
        Sets a ThreadFactory to this controller's thread pool, which allows specially designed threads from the factory to be used by the pool.
        Parameters:
        factory - the ThreadFactory to set to this controller's thread pool.

      • setRejectedExecutionHandler

        public void setRejectedExecutionHandler(java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionHandler handler)
        Sets a RejectedExecutionHandler to this controller's thread pool, providing a process for handling the rejection of tasks passed to it.
        Parameters:
        handler - the RejectedExecutionHandler to set to this controller's thread pool.

      • setThreadPoolProperties

        public void setThreadPoolProperties(int corePoolSize,
                                    int maximumPoolSize,
                                    long keepAliveTime,
                                    java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the properties of the thread pool. This method allows for the properties of the thread pool to be changed or more finely configured after the instantiation of this controller. The core pool size, maximum pool size, and keep alive time can all be adjusted here.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the minimum number of threads to be available at all times.
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads that could be created.
        keepAliveTime - the raw number for the amount of time to keep threads beyond the core pool size alive.
        unit - the unit of time for the keepAliveTime value.

      • actionPerformed

        public final void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Receives an ActionEvent from a view and passes it to another thread for parsing and execution. If the event comes from a GUI class that implements ListenerView, the getValueForAction(String) method on the view is invoked BEFORE the task is passed to another thread. This acquires any necessary values from the view while still on the EventDispatchThread, ultimately passing those values along with the event to the background thread.
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent to execute.

      • processEvent

        protected abstract void processEvent(java.lang.String actionCommand,
                                     java.lang.Object valueFromView)
        Process events passed from views and execute the appropriate response to them on background threads. The event's action command and any value(s) from the view that are necessary for execution are provided as parameters.

        Because of the concurrent nature of this class, this method WILL be invoked from multiple threads. Therefore its implementation should use synchronization where necessary to ensure concurrent access.

        The getValueForAction(String) method from ListenerView is invoked before this method is, and the valueFromView parameter will contain any values provided by that method, or null if none were.

        Parameters:
        actionCommand - the action to be executed.
        valueFromView - the value returned by getValueForAction(String) in the ListenerView interface. If no value is set to be returned by the view that sent this event, this parameter will be null.

      • propertyChange

        public final void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
        Receive PropertyChangeEvents and pass them to the views registered with this controller. Because of the concurrent nature of this class, the view classes are passed back to the EventDispatchThread before the changeProperty(PropertyChangeEvent) method is invoked. This ensures that the view classes will have their single-thread-access guarantee protected.
        Specified by:
        propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
        Overrides:
        propertyChange in class AbstractController
        Parameters:
        event - the PropertyChangeEvent to pass to the views.
